intro: Pedicularis longiflora subsp. tubiformis, commonly known as the tubular lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is characterized by its distinctive tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, designed to attract specific pollinators. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, often in rocky or grassy areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, spurred flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinator populations.
